intro: Dracophyllum mackeeanum, commonly known as the Mackee's dracophyllum, is a shrub native to the high-altitude regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Dracophyllum mackeeanum is often found in cloud forests and is an important component of the local flora.
